messages.title: A BETTER FUTURE
messages.content: Most of us have the same priorities: work, good housing, health and well-being and great education for our children. To ensure the quality of life that truly makes the Bury St Edmunds one of the best places to live in the country it is important that we maximise opportunities and preserve tradition for all.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Supporting measures to ensure the delivery of affordable homes for working families and sustainable developments.
Helping to create a strong local economy with more secure jobs and good wages.
Ensuring everyone in the constituency has access to reliable broadband and wireless services.
Understanding and supporting the concerns of rural areas to protect the local economy.
Improving local transport links and ensuring the infrastructure is fit for the 21st century.

issues.economy: Benefits cap 'leads more into work'. Tax cuts for workers and savers. The deficit down. Income tax cut. More jobs. New businesses.
issues.education: Ensuring schools, colleges and employers build young people's skills for future jobs.

housing.content: Supporting measures to ensure the delivery of affordable homes for working families and sustainable developments.

quotes.text: Jo's really concerned about the things that worry me

images.caption: Candidate Jo Churchill interacting with various individuals and groups within her constituency.
